title: Christopher Luxon
added: In February 2021, it was revealed that while Luxon was CEO of [[Air NZ]], Air New Zealand's contracting business unit Gas Turbines was providing assistance to Royal Saudi Navy vessels, despite them blocking essential supplies like water, food and medical assistance from Yemen. Luxon claimed to "have no recollection of it" and that "it might've post-dated my time" - the latter claim being disputed by his successor Greg Foran. It was met with criticism from Prime Minister [[Jacinda Ardern]] and [[Green Party of Aotearoa New Zealand|Green Party]] MP [[Golriz Ghahraman]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.newshub.co.nz/home/politics/2021/02/former-air-nz-ceo-national-mp-christopher-luxon-says-he-was-unaware-of-saudi-navy-contract.html|title=Former Air NZ CEO, National MP Christopher Luxon says he was unaware of Saudi navy contract|via=www.newshub.co.nz}}</ref>
